bill.title: Health.
bill.description: An act to amend Section 1220 of the Business and Professions Code, to amend Sections 100504 and 100505 of the Government Code, to amend Sections 1266, 1279.2, 1367.54, 1373.622, 1420, 1423, 104150, 104322, 110050, 120960, 120962, 124040, and 124977 of, to amend the heading of Chapter 17 (commencing with Section 121348) of Part 4 of Division 105 of, and to add Sections 120780.2, 121348.4, 122425, 122430, and 122435 to, the Health and Safety Code, to amend Sections 10123.184 and 10127.16 of the Insurance Code, to amend Section 19548.2 of the Revenue and Taxation Code, to amend Sections 4369, 4369.1, 4369.2, 4369.3, 4369.4, 4369.5, 14007.2, 14007.5, 14015.5, 14105.94, 14105.192, 14154, 14186, 14186.1, 14186.3, 15894, and 24005 of, to amend and repeal Section 14134 of, and to add Sections 14007.8 and 14127.7 to, the Welfare and Institutions Code, to amend Sections 70 and 71 of Chapter 23 of, and to amend Section 5 of Chapter 361 of, the Statutes of 2013, and to amend Section 1 of Chapter 551 of the Statutes of 2014, relating to health, and making an appropriation therefor, to take effect immediately, bill related to the budget.

history.action: Introduced. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.
From printer. May be acted upon on or after February 11. Read first time.
From committee: Ordered to second reading.
Read second time. Ordered to third reading.
Read third time. Passed. (Ayes 23. Noes 13. Page 378.) Ordered to the Assembly.
In Assembly. Read first time. Held at Desk.
Referred to Com. on BUDGET. From committee with author's amendments. Read second time and amended. Re-referred to Com. on BUDGET.
From committee with author's amendments. Read second time and amended. Re-referred to Com. on BUDGET.
From committee with author's amendments. Read second time and amended. Re-referred to Com. on BUDGET.

Assembly Rule 96 suspended. Withdrawn from committee. Ordered to third reading. Assembly Rule 63 suspended. Amendments by Assembly Member Chang tabled on motion by Assembly Member Holden. (Ayes 53. Noes 27. Page 2056.) Read third time. Passed. (Ayes 52. Noes 27. Page 2057.) Ordered to the Senate.
In Senate. Concurrence in Assembly amendments pending.
Unanimous consent granted to take up without reference to file. Assembly amendments concurred in. (Ayes 28. Noes 12. Page 1509.) Ordered to engrossing and enrolling.
Enrolled and presented to the Governor at 9:30 a.m.
Chaptered by Secretary of State. Chapter 18, Statutes of 2015.
